revised_title: Immunological Control of Human Protozoal Diseases: Target Antigens in Malaria Transmission Blocking Immunity
tldr: This article discusses the development of transmission blocking immunity against malaria, a method that targets specific antigens in the parasite's life cycle to prevent its transmission between humans and mosquitoes. The authors identify target antigens in the gametes and zygotes stages of the parasite, and explore the potential of immunization to reduce the overall rate of malaria transmission and help combat drug-resistant strains.
